ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Blacksmithing
ygData.msgSnippet:
try http://www.eqtraders.com go down to recipies and start looking there for
things you can do, they have all kinds of skills just be prepared though
that some
ygData.messageBody:
try http://www.eqtraders.com go down to recipies and start looking there for things you can do, they have all kinds of skills just be prepared though that some of the higher end stuff require you to also be able to, or have access to someone to do other skills for you. Take baking for example my enchanter is at 216 skill on it but to make some of the foods she has to be able to brew barbeque sauce so her brewing also is going up, good thing as well as I understand when she gets working on the shawl quest she's going to end up doing them all pretty much.
 
Flaumigavylke
66 Feralkin Epic'd Beastlord
Silver Tears of Flame
 
"Understand your limits, but never limit your understanding"
-------Original Message-------
 
From: Kevin Ross
Date: 02/20/05 04:32:16
To: everquest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Blacksmithing
 
I started blacksmithing.  So far I've got it up to 38 points without
putting too much money in it besides spending on molds, sharpening
stones, and water.  I'd like to keep it that way.  But now it's
becoming a little less clear how I should proceed since the things I
make no longer give me more experience.

So far things have gone as follows:

rusty stuff -> tarnished stuff -> ore -> metal bits.  From metal bits
I'd make either files, studs, or skewers.

Basically, I'm wondering if there are more easy to find stuff that I
can make things from that will further my experience as a blacksmith?


Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
